name: Tokyo
popular_attractions: Tokyo Skytree, Shibuya Crossing, Meiji Shrine
local_customs: Bow when greeting someone, remove shoes indoors

name: Delhi
popular_attractions: Red Fort, Qutub Minar, Jama Masjid
local_customs: Namaste as a common greeting, handshakes are also used

name: Shanghai
popular_attractions: The Bund, Yu Garden, Oriental Pearl Tower
local_customs: Avoid pointing with your finger, use an open hand instead

name: São Paulo
popular_attractions: Ibirapuera Park, Paulista Avenue, São Paulo Museum of Art
local_customs: Brazilians often greet with a kiss on the cheek

name: Mexico City
popular_attractions: Zocalo, Chapultepec Park, Frida Kahlo Museum
local_customs: Handshakes are common, close friends may hug or kiss on the cheek

name: Cairo
popular_attractions: Giza Pyramids, Egyptian Museum, Khan El Khalili
local_customs: Use right hand for greeting and eating, avoid showing the sole of your shoe

name: Mumbai
popular_attractions: Gateway of India, Elephanta Caves, Marine Drive
local_customs: Namaste as a common greeting, handshakes are also used

name: Beijing
popular_attractions: Great Wall of China, Forbidden City, Tiananmen Square
local_customs: Handshakes are common, avoid physical contact with strangers

name: Osaka
popular_attractions: Osaka Castle, Universal Studios Japan, Dotonbori
local_customs: Bow when greeting someone, remove shoes indoors

name: Karachi
popular_attractions: Mohatta Palace, Mazar-e-Quaid, Karachi Safari Park
local_customs: Men shake hands, women may greet with a hug or a handshake

name: Chongqing
popular_attractions: Three Gorges Dam, Hongya Cave, Ciqikou
local_customs: Handshakes are common, avoid physical contact with strangers

name: Istanbul
popular_attractions: Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace
